review: Red Robin is Red Robin; you get mass produced burgers, fries and sandwiches for a moderate price. It's a staple; you can pretty much always count on it being decent. Service is typically pretty decent and pretty fast, and if it's not they always make up for it. More recently we went so we could eat lunch and watch the Seahawks get clobbered in the bar. I was a little dismayed at just how expensive the house margarita was, at $7. I ordered the blue ribbon burger, and Cam had the Whiskey River BBQ Chicken burger. As I said above, pretty much always decent.  We keep coming back, but we try to limit our visits to once or twice a year.

We have always had great service at this location!  We usually go to mom and pop places, but if you are looking for a chain restaurant this is pretty good.  Has lots of options for different people and tasty too.  It is a place the kids are always happy to go too.

I really like this location. The waiters, waitresses and the hostess are very friendly and always have a smile on their face. It gets busy especially on the weekends. My wife and I have never had to wait to long for a seat. I love the variety of burgers, sandwiches, wraps and salads you can choose from. My favorite burger is the A-1 Peppercorn burger and it costs $10.39. The burger comes with applewood smoked bacon, melted pepper-jack cheese, A.1. peppercorn spread, crispy onion straws and tomatoes on an onion bun. Oh yeah you can't forget the bottom less steak fries which are delicious!!!! Another item I love to order is the Rookie Magic Shake or go with the classic chocolate shake and get them monster sized for $4.49. You can never go wrong with Red Robin.
Service was perfect, food wass served extremely hot. Was a very nice experience for us.

Disappointed... Parking: tons. Ambiance:  Typical Red Robin decor - carousel horses, airplanes, eclectic framed pics. Service:  It's a Thursday night and we still had to wait 15 min to get a table!  Service so-so,  was waiting a long time to get a refill on fries and drink, when the waiter finally came along he asked if we wanted a box - and I was like - ummm, can we get some service before you kick us out??? We had 2 birthdays at the table, I thought they usually sing and bring something by but our waiter never did. Food:  So, this was the best part of the experience, had the "Burnin' Love" burger - and yes, I did fall in love with it!  Loved the jalapenos/salsa/chipotle mayo!!!  My son got the chicken quesadilla - he finished the ENTIRE basket.  Hubby got the new big melt bacon - loaded with bacon, just a hint of BBQ - he liked it. Recommendation: Get the Burnin' Love burger if you like yours hot - but get it at another RR location...

It's really hard to write a review for this place, even though I eat there all the time, the most simple thing I can say is, is that this Red Robin is consistently, inconsistent. One night you can have an amazing server, and one of the best burgers of your life, the next time you can have have terrible food, and a waitress/waiter who basically only takes your order, brings your drink, someone else from the kitchen brings your food, and by the time your half through with your meal, your server appears once again, with your bill, and it's not even a busy night.  I will say though, that  their food is kind of bland, and for the most part relies on their seasoning mostly comprised of salt for flavor. But Red Robin offers reasonable prices, and a nice environment for a casual meal. And I know other people love 'em, but I've never been a fan of their freckled lemonades But they do make good drinks at the bar, if I was judging solely based on the bar, I would give it 5 stars.
I love this local Red Robin. The servers are nice, the manager checks on us almost everytime we visit. I've been trying all the different burgers, there really is a lot of variety.

My husband and I take our two little boys (almost 3 and almost 1) to this Red Robin usually once a week.  If you have kids, you know that fast service is essential.  This location is, hands-down, the fastest restaurant I've ever been to.  The food arrives just minutes after the appetizer, the chocolate milk comes quickly, and they seem be in tune with when we need to leave because our kids are getting crazy.   If I didn't have kids, I'd probably feel a bit rushed, but with kids...it totally makes it the perfect place to eat.
I was here on June 16th & spent $34.40 on lunch for the kids.  The service was prompt.  Thank you Julia for keeping the drinks coming.

I've gone to many Red Robin locations, but this review is based purely on my ONE experience at this location. We arrived here around 9 PM for a late dinner on a Thursday.  We had just worked worked out really hard and decided to treat ourselves by gaining the calories we lost back!  They seated us, and we ordered, and I've never had our order come out so quickly!  Talk about fast food!   We ordered clucks and fries and a Red Tavern burger with fries and two strawberry lemonade.  It was the standard food fare we like to order from Red Robin but without as long as a wait!

Came Here a few nights ago for a going away party. The host was super friendly and we were happy waiting twenty minutes to be sat. We went to the bar and there was no bartender to serve us. After trying to get attention from someone, anyone for 15 minutes, we gave up.  Ten minutes later we were sat. The table was sticky and I asked for a rag to clean it. I never got one.  We had a short blonde haired server who asked how we were splitting up our bills before we even ordered food. Very unprofessional. It took twenty minutes to get us a few beers. She was both snotty and seemingly stuck up. Our food was decent, but a bad server can ruin any experience. I will not be going here again. Save yourself a head ache and go somewhere else.

Went here last Sat. for lunch with my wife and daughter. The place was not busy at all. The hostess noticed us but never made eye contact and continued to gossip to her co-worker. I waited for about 3 minutes by the podium when we decided to leave and walk across the parking-lot to Buffalo WIld-Wings. I was served right away and the food was good. I will never go to this Red Robin again.

I went to a Red Robin once about 20 years ago and was not all that impressed. I could not remember why. My wife and I dropped in to this one today. We had turkey clubs that seemed to have a thin slice of pressed turkey product (not fresh turkey breast) and  the bread was held together with gobs of cheese. I'm not big on cheese so this may be one of my problems with RR.  The food seems really overpriced for the amount and quality provided. The allegedly bottomless fries are served to you at about 7 fries at a time. I guess for the truly patient they could score a lot of fries. I'd rather get a full order first time around and be done with it. Service was very good. The dining area was noisy, the music was too loud. I basically don't like this place. Maybe I'll try it again in 20 years or so.

Disclaimer: This review is only for this location. I have always liked Red Robin. Good burgers (my go-to burger is the Royal Red Robin), steak fries, etc. I usually go to the Bellevue Square Red Robin because of the location's convenience. I've always liked going to Red Robin; they have great service and really friendly staff. So when I went to David's Bridal with a couple of my girlfriends, we decided to go to Red Robin in Alderwood/Lynnwood. I was deeply disappointed. The service was ridiculously bad. First, the server messed up my friend's salad. She ordered a Southwest Grilled Chicken Salad with a few personalization. When it came, it was wrong. The chicken was just a plain grilled chicken, not seasoned like it was supposed to be. My friend mentioned this to our server, and he said that he ordered it that way because he thought she didn't want any seasoning. (She had ordered her dressing on the side.) He just assumed that she didn't want seasoned chicken. My friend started to give back the plate, but our server said, "Oh, I'll just get you another chicken." My friend wasn't happy. He then relented and took her plate, offering to make a new one. Second, we had ordered a basket of fries to share, and our server failed to bring that out. He eventually did, but it was towards the end of our meal! Another server then brought us another basket of fries. At the end of our meal, we had 2 baskets of fries... That was a waste of fries (and our time). The other server, the one that brought us our extra basket of fries was also very rude to us.  Third, when we decided that we should just pay and get out of there, our server messed up the bill. We did separate checks, which has never been a problem at any Red Robin locations I've visited. Both me and my friend have Red Royalty Rewards Cards. He took our cards and mixed up our bills - I got my friend's free burger, and her order was put on my card. It was confusing and frustrating, to say the least. I would have given a 1-star, because we left the establishment more frustrated than when we came in. However, since the food tasted good (Red Robin standard), I decided to give another star. I understand that people have bad days. Maybe our server had a bad day. Maybe our server was new to the job. It was just mistakes after mistakes, without any explanation or proper apologies. We were frustrated. I might just stick with the other Red Robin locations in the future.

I took my wife and her brother and sister to Red Robin, to bless them.  The people came at first very enthusiastic and happy to serve us.   I asked for strawberry lemondae my fav...They brought it to the table, it tasted like listerine...so i asked for a new one.  Brother got a raspberry drink and it tasted sour.  BOttom line drinks were terrible. We ordered food, bleu cheese burger was gross...and they were not very persistant on coming back when we needed things like there really good ranch...and honey mustard.   This Red Robin is the best one I have been there more then 20 times and service has been great.  But they really dissapointed me on that service!   Bad service

This was a different experince for me. The manager came out and tried to smooth it over but was a little late. The waitress that I had, clearly was in a bad mood. She took our orders, brought them out cold, then left the check. She GAVE US THE CHECK AT THE SAME TIME AS OUR FOOD! She didn't offer desert, she didn't offer a refill, she gave us our check and never check on us again. Usually, Red Robin is great and we love it. My daughter thinks its the best place on earth. Just not this night.

I'm so shocked at all the bad reviews for this location, but, to each their own. I always have a good experience coming to this location. We went this past weekend and it was crazy busy, but they turned over tables fast!  We ordered a teriyaki chicken burger and the teriyaki burger one. Both with some "without" requests. They came perfectly and crazy fast for how busy they were!  The server was great and I watched how all the servers were moving about the floor. Very efficient and friendly. There was a man on the floor wh must have been a main manager.....you can tell a lot about a manager based on how the staff acts around him. They were all laughing, joking and talking to him, none avoided him. Clearly they had a good working relationship  Is Red Robin food spectacular? Depends on what you like. I like a cheap, consistent burger with awesome steak fries. RR delivers, every time.
Guacamole too salty, French onion soup too salty, breaded clam strips cold and too much breading, sweet potato fries cold. High point- service was good - thank you Matthew.

I love Red Robin! My family had been going to multiple locations for almost 20 years. The Alderwood RR is nice and clean, great staff and the food is terrific. Great salads and burgers. I've had almost everything on the menu. The mud pie is awesome but they changed it recently and it's not as great.

Haven't had huge problems at this RR except for when we sat at the bar and was completely ignored by our server. All other times were just dandy. The wait can be long sometimes depending on the time you arrive. They try to seat you as quickly as possible. For those 21+, try the bar (it's small, but since it's a family restaurant there are usually open tables). The service is chipper, sometimes a little too chipper. But the food has been typical RR and I have nothing to complain about. I love that RR offers the protein versions now (lettuce wrapped burgers). Not bad for a burger and steak fries.

Red Robin ... yummmm.  I just like doing that with my older son who does the yum part.  Anyway, this Red Robin has over the years become the family birthday celebration locale, as well as other family celebrations.  You just cannot go wrong with Red Robin for a great selection of burgers, all with those thick fries.  I like the fish & chips, but sometimes I just get the fish burger.  They have a decent selection of beers on tap, not expansive, but you'll find a few microbrews, usually a good line up from Sam Adams, Mac & Jack, Blue Moon, etc.  This place is always packed, especially on a weekend night, where the wait could be 20 minutes or more.  Red Robin has their formula down.  It's a very successful chain and with good reason.

This place can be very hit or miss but last Sunday night it was closer to being a hit.  A girl friend and I sat in the bar and had some drinks and snacks.  Their cherry lime flip is one of my favorite drinks anywhere and it was especially tasty after doing a little Christmas shopping.  If you like to go to Red Robin and you like to have a nice, tangy drink with a little vodka in it give it a try!  I also had their zucchini wedges with ranch and they hit the spot.  The friend I went with had the whiskey river bbq chicken wrap.  She loved it.  Our server was attentive but he did screw up - he carded me but not my friend.  Oops.  :)

endless fries, great ranch dressing, yummy salads (chicken or cobb), great burgers (any), satisfying apps (onion ring tower), this place always is consistent. the only thing that stands out in my mind that i wasn't quite a fan of is the chicken teriyaki bowl (not even sure if its still offered). i've stopped by many red robins all over the country :) and today we just happen to be watching the nfl game in the bar today in Lynnwood (close to the mall and really busy during holidays, weekends and game days) we ordered hot wings and drinks-i love the sauce on the wings and had some campfire bbq sauce with the fresh fries. their salads are humungous and i like that you can get them for half the portion if you choose, and this option is available as well for the soup/salad entrée too.  i've never heard anyone say red robin is not good because they simply ARE good, LOL. fun drinks like sand in your shorts and themed milkshakes are always tempting.

Of all places, my daughter chose Red Robin for her birthday dinner. I wish they took reservations. We arrived at 5:10... 20 minutes before their "dinner rush" began. We waited for 15 minutes in the crowded uncomfortable lobby. Dinner came as ordered. Nothing special. The waitstaff almost blew the happy happy b day song, as they waited until my daughter was in the bathroom to gather at the table. They came back later, and sang the song and tried to rush us out with boxes for the stuff we were still eating. The food was fine. The service was just okay, but we did feel rushed.

I used to come to this Red Robin as a kid with my Grandma. She introduced me to the California Chicken sandwich and it's still what I order to this day! I love their steak fries and their house seasoning.  This is one of the better Red Robins I've visited. They're always busy but the service remains consistently good and friendly.  Today I tried honey mustard at the suggestion of my server with the fries and it was delicious!  After an atrocious visit to the Red Robin in Bothell I was very happy to come back to this location and see that they still know how to give good customer service and offer a good product. I do think they should cook their chicken burgers just a tad more. This has been an issue the last few times I've visited. It's not *uncooked*, just a bit underdone in my opinion. The outside is blackened though so it's a bit puzzling.  I have fond memories of coming here and will continue to visit from time to time!
Friendly service, always...and some great burgers. Red Robin's one of those places that you just can't get enough of...in spurs. Will definitely go back! Can't ever go wrong!

its red robin what can i say, it was a good burger with good fries and amazing honey mustard, the restaurant was not really but clean my burger was good, i tried a bite of my friends chicken burger and that left a lot to be desired. 2 star - i had a hair in my fries, i asked the waitress for some more hairless fries, i know it happens so i was making light of the complaint. i showed her the fry has i asked. not even an acknowledgment of the hair. an apology or anything.

I used to like this place, but now over the last 8-9 years it has grown more, and more run down, and unsanitary.  Upon entering the place reeked of the unmistakable stench of mop water, then the tables were sticky, the upholstery was heavily worn, and caked with filth. The blinds were covered with enough dirt I'd swear it was on the verge of composting. There was unmistakable filth everywhere, the decor, and trim was worn out, and sad. As I stood up to leave and grabbing my jacket I saw an insane amount of crumbs, and mystery crap between the the cushion, and bench frame.  I was horrified with the idea of my kids touching anything! Is there such a thing as health inspectors anymore? I don't honestly see how this place would be in business if there are. I'm really tempted to contact their corporate headquarters. This place needs an attitude adjustment.

I'm on the fence with this rating. I wanted something light and ordered the fish sandwich, tilapia. Being fish, it broke apart too easily in my hand. Thank goodness they wrap their sandwiches to keep it from dripping all over your hands. I enjoyed the company of the bar tender, he knew his stuff and would regularly stop by to check in on us.

Nothing special about this location.it's a very busy location and they have long wait times everytime I go between 6 and 7 PM. Prices are good and the service is fair conceding how busy they are. I prefer the Bothell location. For food I recommend getting the bbq whisky wrap or burning love (spicy) burger. Both yummy and satisfying!
Been going here for years and it's always consistently good food and drink at an affordable price.

The place is exactly what you'd expect. A burger restaurant where everything costs about 2 dollars more than it should. I recommend their wraps- they are decent. Don't go if you have a headache. The incessant noise and ruckus is enough to leave you walking out with a headache

Every once in awhile...we gotta go with the old stand by...RR. It's pretty standard affair here....if you've been to one Red Robin, you've been to them all. The waitress forgot to input our appetizer order, so our dinner came....without any sight of those yummy cheese sticks. She realizes her mistake and tries to push it on the kitchen staff saying they forgot...kinda lame.

I brought my family here the other day and I was disapointed to say the least, it wasn't the food, the food was fine. It was the terrible service and dirty surroundings. Come on Red Robin, keep your place clean!

I went with a friend here and was very disappointed tonight with our service. The food was great, but the waitress threw me off guard with a comment she made to me in the beginning. I was not sure whether she was insulting me or playing around. when I asked for a refill she told me it would take some minutes because the soda machine was being refilled. I never did get that last sprite and left kind of thirsty. It was an uncomfortable experience overall. I also did find hair in my food.

Been a red robins customer for a while now and their service is always great. Love their burgers and especially the endless fries! Havnt had a bad experience yet so definitely always a great place to go!
I love their burgers and fries.
Great service in the bar and I can't get enough of that SW chicken salad. Really good. Received a free birthday sandwich this visit too! Such a deal.
Not too loud. Good customer service. Good for groups. Has TV's. Haven't been in the bar, but I can tell it is a relaxed environment. A good local bite to eat.

What happened to Red Robin?  New menu is confusing The paper wrapping the burger us gone, making it a messy eat.  The fries come in some sort tube now, way less then before. Making you order a refill right when you see it.  Ranch is thicker, but container is smaller.  Somebody got paid a lot of money to change things up. They are trying to make it more of a upscale eat. Let's get real, it is burgers and fries and some pub style fair. Service was good food was tasty and entire family was satisfied. Bathroom trips to wash  hands not withstanding.
Never amazing but always good. The best thing they have are the Burgers by far but it's a great place that can accommodate a lot of different ages and taste. So 2 thumbs up

The short of it: standard Red Robin experience. The quality of food is still pretty up there, but the service was a bit "spacey".  Even the prices haven't seemed to change much over the years. Went here with a large group of people on a weekday night: Friendly staff, but out server seemed to "space out" on several things like silverware and drink orders, but she was on top of everything else. For a place that has bottomless fries, I'm a bit surprised the the tortilla chips wouldn't be too; wishful thinking aside, the chips and salsa were pretty good minus the frozen guacamole. The food came out in a pretty timely manor and everyone seemed to enjoy their food. I got the A1 burger and it was very good. All in all, a pretty typical Red Robin experience.
Only go here if you have no idea what a decent restaurant is like.  Circus environment,  Meat cooked to hockey pucks. So many great restaurants and people come here, BAFFLING!
Great food! Great service! I have never had a bad experience at this restaurant. Their burgers are awesome and you can get whatever toppings you want.

I loved Red Robins in CA but this one is terrible.  I've gone twice and I won't be coming back. Bad service both times. We said no lettuce and tomatoes on our bacon cheese burgers. They came out with lettuce and tomatoes on them. We politely sent them back and guess what? They come back with two plain bacon cheeseburgers with nothing else on them and cold fries so our order was wrong again. We didn't even bother sending them back again. The sides of ranch we ordered with the burgers were hot with pieces of lettuce in it...hmm they obviously scrapped the lettuce and tomatoes off. Seriously, 5 fries with the burgers too? Our waitress then disappeared then brings us our check without bringing my drink refill that I asked for 10 minutes ago. I was dying of thirst and wanted more fries. I hate begging for refills. I come here for the fries! They are ruining the franchise! Avoid! I'll never be coming back to this location and I may never go back to a Red Robins again period. What is with their new dumb silver cones of 5 fries instead of the basket of fries that they use to bring to you? Bad mistake. Don't advertise bottomless fries if you are going to train your waitresses to disappear and make people beg for them when they do happen to mosey on by.

Always great service! They'll treat you like family in the bar! Matt, Lori and Angela are always welcoming.  This particular location looks a little due for an update, but still good atmosphere!  The food is always good and made just the way you order it. If there is a mistake they're more than happy to fix it!

Growing up, this place was a staple of our high school years. I used to go to the Northgate branch quite frequently, but we decided to visit the Lynnwood branch this time after not going to Red Robin in a few years. In short, this place has definitely changed. The plates are smaller, the look of the menu is different, the prices are higher and the service is minimal at best.  I remember back in the day when the staff was overly friendly. They would be bringing out baskets of fries for everyone while we waited for our food. The environment was fun and exciting.  Unfortunately, it just wasn't the same. The food was still good. The variety still unique and tasty, but seeing that our waitress mixed up our orders, put the wrong things on the wrong bills, never once filled up our water, and even forgot to bring people things they had ordered, I can't really give it the 4-5 stars that it used to be.  Overall, because this is the closest one to all of us, we probably will still come here, but I miss the good ol days of Red Robin.

My family and I were there a couple weeks ago. There was a ton of chocolate from a previous guest under the table. It got all over my boyfriends clothes; and almost ruined our experience there. Nothing like this has ever happened at this Lynnwood location. The managers on duty went above and beyond to help remove the chocolate. We were very thankful and will definitely be back. THANK YOU SO MUCH!

First I was brought the wrong order, then the royal red robin burger they brought was raw!! hamburber was red inside and cold, and the egg on top was not cooked properly so I had a third hamburger brought out and it still was not that good. Quality and service has dropped lately. Whats goin on in that kitchen? I will not be going back for awhile . 40 bucks for hamburgers and fries. They did not even apologize or offer compensation. Bad service Yuk!!

This is a nice and clean Red Robin.  It's a good size and they are always playing sports in the bar in the middle.  It's a good place to take your family for a nice Sunday afternoon meal, etc. Their freckled lemonade is always a big hit...I always drink way too much of it. Service was good.  The food was ok...and this is why I knocked off 2 stars.  I ordered the french dip and it was ok but the meat was a little too dry.  Even dipping it didn't really bring out much flavor.  It came with fries and cole slaw.  The fries were endless but quality wasn't that great.  The cole slaw was good but was not endless.

For being a chain restaurant it's good. I might have just gotten lucky. To my advantage, they have the option to make any burger a veggie patty. I got the "Burnin Love" Burger which has fried jalapenos on it. Cost about $10 which seems average for a place like this. I also got 2 mai tais which were over $7 each. Service was fine.

They fill the void, I have always enjoyed the tower of onion rings and endless fries.  Menu changes from time to time, so don't get hooked on any "specialty" item, as it usually will be gone the next time you visit. Gramps luvs the milkshakes here, usually he can take home the "second serving" as he calls it, they serve the blender container along with a huge glass with your order. Service is fine, a bit impersonal due to the style of service where once the food comes up in the kitchen someone brings it to you, which is fine. Been visiting this chain since I was a kid and while things have changed over time, in general they come through just fine.

Had a 50$ gift card to come here. Ordered the artichoke dip as a appetizer and two bacon burgers. Our bacon burgers arrived before the appetizer by someone other then our server. When our server James noticed we had our burgers he asked about our appetizer. We had said it had not come yet so he went and grabbed it for us. Both of our burgers had zero flavor. So we had to drench it in honey mustard that we had to ask 3 times for. Nothing was seasoned. Both my bacon and guacamole had no flavor and I spent extra money on them. Overall not impressed for it being a place of burgers.

I love coming here when I'm hungry and wanting and craving a freckled lemonade.  This location is clean and has excellent service. They are always welcoming, friendly, and organized.  Freckled lemonades are yummy and as much as I love the idea of bottomless drinks, I always regret it because I remember how much sugar is in it unfortunately. It's the only place that I order something besides water. I've been stuck on this comfort zone of ordering the same thing over and over, which is the California Chicken Burger. I order it with the bacon on the side (because OMG, yes it's true I don't like bacon lol), and cut in half because I know their burgers can get messy.  Try the honey mustard!!! Only place that has the best honey mustard I've tried!!  I recommend this place, warning it can get busy on weekends or on game days, around holidays, etc.
This location has the worst food of any Red Robin I have ever been too. The building is very cramped and minimal seating.

Great place by the mall. Can get pretty busy during weekends but even during busier times you're always able to get a table within 20 mins or less.  I frequent here multiple times a month for the past two years and the food/service is always consistently good.  Pretty amazing considering the number if servers they have.  One of my favorite things about this place us the selection of dipping sauce.  From their campfire to wing sauce, they're all good.

Stopping by on a Saturday after a long & drawn eye exam, down the street, was so worth it. They seated us right away, even though the place was well packed. The place was clean & bright with really cool pictures (and other interesting stuff) on the walls. Our server was on the ball and super friendly. Our tower of onion rings came quick. That BBQ dipping sauce..... really GOOD!. Our order of Banzai burger & whiskey river chicken burger was prompt and cooked just right. We were in and out within an hour and our favorite music store (Guitar Center), right across the parking lot.....SWEET!
A good solid lunch spot before a movie or the mall.  Its a busy place,  but we got in with maybe a 10 minute wait at the most.  Tasty messy burgers are what you want and that's what you get.

This place has a great atmosphere and some good food for the price.  The servers seem to be a little too busy to take care of everyone even during what appeared to be an incredibly slow lunch.  The server forgot my tartar sauce but I let it go do to what seemed like her own frantic manner.  I just felt rushed compared to most places.  Maybe it was the end of her shift but that's no excuse, race to the finish, not the last lap.

We always sit in the bar so I can't speak for the entire restaurant but even when it's busy the servers are still friendly and it might take a little bit longer to get your food but I blame that on the kitchen not on the servers, we come here so often we know most of the bar staff by name and they always remember us and I just have to say especially Matt he is an amazing server I forgot to get my free birthday burger in March but when we came in April he took care of us and by the way Matt your kids are adorable he is a sweetheart love you Matt

Holy crap when did this place start adding up so fast? $2.50 for an ice tea? Jeeeezzzee. You know what you are in for in terms of food when you come to Red. It's the same all across the board. I ordered the crispy chicken burger because they have always been good in the past. Not this time. It was AWFUL.  So oily, like more than normal, super chewy, springy chicken. Yuck. I couldn't even finish the whole thing. I probably should have sent it back but.. I ordered mac and cheese as my side and it was decent.  The service was a little slow last night. It wasn't super packed in there, we came in before the dinner rush.  So for a ruban, 2 ice teas, a kids pizza, my chicken and pretzel nuggets the bill was $40.  I feel that for the price vs quality, I can find a better place for a burger.
Today I dined in the Bar. James was my server and he was completely awful! By far the worst service I have ever had. NO tip for him thats for sure.

Typical red robin, the great thing about this place is that you know what to expect. Usually the food is always the same. It seems like in recent years the quality has gone down. Things just don't taste as rich as they used to. But when you need a burger fix it's not a bad spot to go. Oh and on anger note, I HATE THE BIRTHDAY SINGING!
I got the soup/salad combo. Worst french onion soup I've ever had! And the salad was lame. I usually love red robin. Disappointed with this location

Me and my wife's go-to spot after work. We usually eat in the bar.  Were becoming regulars here and know almost every bar wait-staff. Matt kyle and Lori are thee best. They always have a good suggestion and keep the conversation fun.  There are the occasional hickups in our order but nothing more than you'd expect from a restaurant as busy as Red Robin! Plus if they do make a mistake they're so fast on correcting it! If you're looking for a great place to have a drink a burger and feel among friends look no further than in the bar at this location (other locations are a tragically different story).

I only write reviews to warn people.  I'm like most people, if it meets my expectations created by their own words/advertising, I don't review it for the most part.  So read this because I care... I mean you're on yelp to get the straight dope or what? A charitable take on things.... Completely disgusting. The lemonade tasted of sanitizers (maybe they used lemon scented sanitizer instead of the box concentrate).  It was foul, like the pipes the lemonade had to travel through were caked with bacterial plaque build-up from not bein maintained in at least a decade.  My daughter became sick and threw up on the way running to the bathroom. There was hair in my burger.   The really hairy kind.  Eew. Appetizers looked like they got recovered from the Chernobyl waste pit, but worse. they did however, innovate the new self-serve concept of getting your own silverware and condiments to make you feel at home.  Now YOU get to be the waiter, it's like those automated supermarket check stands. In all honesty though, I feel terrible for the manager, who offered to make it up with some free dessert.  We noticed her running around apologizing to table after table.  She keot insisting on giving us some free dessert, ignoring the fact that i told her my son is diabetic and we prefer not to have another insulin shot.  We told her to keep it. People should demand that health department grades and violations be posted on the windows of restaurants like in other states.  Even a "people love us on yelp" door sticker isn't big enough to hide a dissapointing report card.
Food is consistently "good".  The service however is always awesome. They will deal with a walk in 40 top smiling gratuitously! :)
Went there after work  around 10pm, still lots of people. Guess they must be attractive. ordered rib dip and chicken soup. taste good, reasonable price.

Great stop with the kids for a near-midnight snack! Wait looked long but was less than 5 minutes. Service was great! Food was predictable and spot-on. There are few options after 10 and this was a win. Fish and chips was complete with extra tartar. Chicken strips were perfect.

I had similar complaint on Bellevue Square. Service is poor. Bottomless fries a misnomer. The only thing bottomless is the tin cup they are served in. Asked if we wanted more fries 2/3 of the way through our meal, they never showed up before the bill came. Anything else he asked?  Where are my fries. We sat and waited for the HALF basket to appear then took the skimpy portion with us and left. Oh, and then the thing about two place settings for three people. Where is the server?  My tip? Right next to the bottomless fries at the bottom of the cup. Oh. Must have fallen out  Two strikes for Red Robin. Herfys is making a come back and they may not have bottomless fries but when you order the meal the serving is HUGE!!!  You get one more try Red Robin then you're out in my book.

I tried calling to do take out. The waitress answered the phone laughing and continued laughing the whole time I was on the phone with her, she asked me to repeat myself 5+ times before I told her I wanted a double cheese burger. Absolutely ridiculous. I hung up on her due to the fact that I needed a gluten free bun and no sauce due to my allergy and wasn't willing to repeat myself another 5-10 times.

I can see why this place has mixed reviews!  me & my lovely partner (in love & crime) decided to make it a date night we stopped here for dinner last night (8/10/14). I had an absolutely Absolut something something lemonade & my darling had a "boozy shake". The bartender wasn't greedy on the liquor for my drink (& I'm not complaining AT ALL) & the boozy shake tasted like a chocolate shake with a hint of bailey's..yum! The thing I didn't like though was that we ordered an appetizer (o - ring shorty) but sadly our entrées came BEFORE our appetizer. Another thing was with the onion ring tower we only had about 5 onion rings on it. Whaaaaat?! That's not a tower! Also the burger patty wasn't seasoned but I had grilled onions, and sautéed mushrooms to disguise that. But we did have the cheesecake for dessert & the waitress told us it came from the cheesecake factory. It was sooooooo good!  All in all this place wouldn't be my first choice to eat and I don't think I would recommend it too often either.

I will definitely give this particular location a 4 out of 5 stars. Reason: their employees I went in with my kid tonight, and as expected for a Monday night, it wasn't packed. We were quickly seated and served our drinks. Typically I order the Royal but I was craving the creamy macaroni and cheese they have, and their cod. Unfortunately, it was a Monday night and the food wasn't up to the usual par.  Having past experience working in this field, I understand that off nights exist.  Not only did my waitress understand, she got the manager who came over and made sure I was okay, that I didn't need a replacement, and removed the item from my bill. Amazing customer service!!! I appreciate customer service! So, minus one star because the food kinda sucked tonight, but 4 stars for awesome staff.
The best service is in the bar... they are great...everyone loves Red Robin they are a institution.  Good food, good prices,  great service what more can you ask for?
Food is consistent. Service can be slow when they are busy but overall a good cheap date spot :)

Great food and gluten free options, the service is always great also.  My only issue is the extremely frumpy staff and the fact that I loose my appetite every time I see a waiter walk by.  With the exception of a few, the girls all have orange tans and caked on make up. The guys all seem to wear women's jeans a size too small. This is a great "in your face" reminder to order a salad... Even skip desert.
My son loves this place.  He well get either chicken on a stick or the Rad Robin burger.
I really like this particular location. My wife and I always have a great time. Just go to the bar and split a burger and get a couple drinks.

The 5 Star rating is for Tyler the bar tender. 2 friends and I stopped in Monday night 9/22 about 30 minutes or less before closing which I normally hate to do because the staff is rushing to close everything down so they can get out at a decent hour but all 3 of us had a craving for some Red Robin. Tyler came right over and greeted us with menus and took drink orders right away, was back quickly to take our Appetizer and Entree orders, answered questions, my one buddy is a pretty picky eater and Tyler got his order spot on and didn't make a big fuss about the take offs and add ons from his Burger. Tyler made us feel like we could have stayed and talked for 2 more hours, coming by and checking if we needed more fries, bringing extra sauces for us and refilling drinks before we had to ask. The good thing for Tyler is that all 3 of us work in a tipping industry and we all commented on how great he was as a server and tipped him generously. I probably wouldn't of wrote this review if it wasn't for Tyler and his A+ Customer Service. The food was typical Red Robin food, nothing overly special but a good Hamburger and Cheese Sticks. Hopefully Management sees this and gives Tyler a raise!!

I have already reviewed Red Robin a few times but I haven't reviewed this particular location or this server and she deserves to be recognized for an outstanding job. Her name was Donetta :) What a sweet, sweet young lady. As we were waiting to be seated, my kids were throwing fits. To the point where I told my husband that we should just abort this mission. He thought that if they could just get their food, they'd calm down so we stayed. As we were seated, Donetta promptly took our order and we just ordered 1 kids meal for my kids to split. Without even asking, she had it out on two separate plates ( win!!! ) in less than five minutes. What!? So my kids instantly became happier! She had our food out not much longer after that. She checked on us frequently and when my son was finished eating ( he's 15 months ) she played peekaboo with him from behind the bar. She laughed and giggled with him and I'm pretty sure he developed his first girl crush, hehe. Moms know how it is... You just want ONE NIGHT with your family to not have to cook dinner and to relax... I really thought eating out was going to be a nightmare but it turned into a relaxing fun evening out with my family and I want to thank Donetta for that. What an amazing asset to the team!
Always a great place to go. Sit in the bar, prefer your food without munchkins running amok. But beware of the booze add to their shakes. Pretty hefty.

I called in my order for pick up today. But there was miscommunication on what I wanted on my burger.  Now your probably wondering why I am still giving them a 5 star review. It's because of the customer service. I called back and let them know what had happened. They were very so polite about the error and were able to get me a new burger so quickly.  I will be back soon for the great food, amazing service and maybe one of those alcoholic grasshopper milkshakes!!

Having been to Red Robin in Seattle, Bellevue, Mill Creek, and Redmond, I have to say, this Red Robin is by far the worst of them all. The food just seems to carry that extra sheen of grease that kindly reminds me that I'm about to eat someone's bad day formed into a soggy burger. Couple that with oily and limp fries and I'm sold: never coming back here again. Blech.

In the North end of Seattle, this is the best RR.  Northgate is horrible and extremely busy.  The one on the Pier is good, but it is currently closed. As a member of the Royalty program, I can tell you that you'll get really good value here.  Prices are typical for RR, but the staff here are really friendly and good to work with.  The food came out in good time, and I got the discounts that I was looking for.  Our server was also super friendly. This is a great location to take kids for a birthday or if you have a family movie night at one of the Alderwood theaters.

Yeah I don't even know what to say I ordered fries and a side of ranch and I get this? You can't even fill up a 1 yead old with this, where am I? Am I in narnia? What's going on here ? I can't even get a full set of fries this place is nuts! This place is so busy they give me a one ! That's it? Felt like a new born baby in a wheelchair , 1 star to these fake ass waiters

Came in and got the red tavern fries dam those fries were a mess looked like bunch of kindergarteners stomped all over my food super sloppy enough calories to make you jump off a cliff with Turkey breasts in your pockets 3 stars to these cheesy chumps

We love coming here. Food is good, waiters are usually very friendly and its an easy go to place with the kids. Sometimes the food doesn't come out too hot or the fries seem they have been around for a while. Also bathrooms, kinda gross. Someone needs to be cleaning them more often. Hostess that's there at night needs to be more friendly. Same gal seems to be in the same bad mood :(

Came in to this location on Sunday around 2 pm, with 8 adults and 7 kids.  I was not expecting the best service or having food on time.  Got ta say we got lucky with our server, he was amazing. He took all of our orders and in no time we had our food on the table.  He was able to manage all of our drinks and fries refills with out any of us asking for it.  We all left very happy!!! Thank you so much!  We will be back!

Excellent food and great service. Busy place especially after a SeaHawks win and the free promotion for the burger. We sat in the bar next to the kids area. You're able to watch all the screens for sports. Food came quickly and Alexis our server was very busy but able to hit all her tables regularly. She's the best!

If you come here during dinner time it seems to be the time when it's the busiest, every single time i have came during dinner time there was atleast a 20 min wait. There menu has more options now and are more vegetarian friendly.

We come here  alot. This is the best Red Robin in the north end. Josh was our server last night. He was new! He was very attentive to me and my girls. I am a member of the royalty program so on  top of the good service and good food. I received a free burger.

This is the first time me and my boyfriend have came to this location. To say the least we had a terrible experience. We came in on a Sunday at 130ish. It wasn't too busy. The first thing too turn me away was when we walked in. They're was four waitresses just standing, chatting with each other. We didn't even get greeted with a hello or anything. Finally someone noticed us and took us to a table. Once we arrived I automatically noticed the table we were at at was wobbley and are drinks kept trying to slide off. I had to ask to move to a different table. Which was fine but the next table wasn't even clean. -crumbs and leftover food was still sticking to the table. But still we disregarded the filth. Then we order. Food came in an orderly time, but the waitress messed up my order. Its funny because when I ordered I was very specific about my cod burger. I did want want the shredded cabagge. Somehow she mixed it up with a fried chicken burger?...and when I mentioned to her that my order was wrong she huffed and puffed. -Rude and unprofessional too say the least....food tasted well. I was pleased with the actual meal but the service and cleanliness of this location was absolutely horrible. I will sadly not be returning.  In conculsion, I think this location should speak with they're staff about customer service and teach them how to properly clean tables. Pretty easy tasks but seemed too hard for this waitress to accomplish.  If you want to enjoy Red Robins food I would recommend going to the Arlington location! They are wonderful all the way around.

I was not looking forward to going due to some problems in the past with this chain, but we had some certificates to burn through and the kids love the Mac and cheese.  First, the place was busy as hell, but the staff was on top of every little thing.  They didn't hover over us while we ordered, but gave us time. Then they periodically checked in with us, rather than abandoning us until the end.  So I would say just the right amount of attention all night.  Oh, did I say they were busy?  They were busy, but fast, efficient, and friendly.   We had several partially used cards - no problem -they checked them all for us.  Wife's burger was a little burnt - got that taken care of in a matter of several minutes.  Overall, I felt that they did a great job, they took good care of us, and we got great service not excuses. As I said, I'm not a huge fan of the chain, but when the kids want to go, and they will want to go, I would much rather make the drive to Lynnwood than the ones closer to home.

Why?  Why did I let my leeches... I mean children... Talk me in to going back here?  On a Friday!  The wait was fine.. Maybe about 15 minutes.  Then, I ended up waiting ten minutes to see the waiter.  Ten minutes for beverages.  We finally got our food at about the one hour mark.  The waiter was nice, lots of annoying check ins telling us our food would be right up.  It never was. People seated well after us were getting their meals before us - I really hate that.  The food, when it got to the table after waiting for an hour, was tasty, and exactly what we came for.  We never got our beverages refilled, and neither did the tables on either side of us.  This location is the worst.  I don't care what happens, we are never going back to this location again.
The macaroni is one of my favorites  here! They  also have the best veggie burgers  around. The service  is always fast and consistent.

I think this Red Robin has a new manager since I have been in. I used to have bad experiences but lately I've come back and have been pleasantly surprised! I was thinking about ordering a boca burger because I have never had one and the manager overheard my conversation and said to try it and if I don't like it they will make me a new one. I tried it and didn't like it. I hate to waste food so I didn't say anything and the manager came around and saw I had barely made a dent in it. He brought me something new and it was delicious. I love how fast our food came even on a busy night and the waitress was super nice. The only complaint I have about this place is that the table didn't seem very clean and there was food shoved in the seats. Nothing too crazy, the customer service definitely made up for the slightly dirty table.

Went here with friends after the movie. There were lots of birthday s and packed with many families. My salad was huge:avocado,bacon,egg,chicken,blue cheese and so for and with tip $12 and that didn't include a drink since I didn't see any adult drinks I liked. Burgers are about $8-$13 which includes those bottomless fries of course or you can get the sweet potato fries which someone at the table got,I'm sure they are more of course. We didn't get dessert or appetizer things. The server thought we were all together since no one said anything but that's to be expected.

Always love Red Robin!! Had the Spring Chicken sandwich- delish, with goat cheese, bacon, and sun-dried tatoes. My sin had his usual- the Whisky River bbq burger. Jeremy and Carlos were friendly, efficient and attentive. Will definitely be back!so good.

I usually love Red Robin, but we had a lot of issues tonight.  We had to ask several times for one of the items we ordered, salads came without dressing, we were charged for refills on items listed as "bottomless" on the menu, and our waitress repeatedly asked us if we were ready for dessert before we even had all of our dinner.  She seemed put - out whenever we asked for anything - I would have gone to the kitchen myself if that was an option!
Despite the fact that they were nearly empty, the service and food were lousy.  I used to come here all the time. Now I remember why I stopped.

I walked into the Red Robins at around 8 on sunday service was shit am i suppose to ask the host what tables available am i suppose to greet the host to be served? someone in management should teach the young bratty attitudy bitch how to greet people and make them feel welcome. Not coming back ever

I love this location. They hire the best of the best. I have only had one not so favorable waitress, but Angela (I think that's her name. Pixie cut and is from the Midwest) is incredible and hands down one of the best waitresses I've ever had. She's personable, attentive and very friendly.  My food is always perfect and fresh. I prefer this location over the rest. Props to the awesome team here.

Decided to have dinner here last night, had to wait 20 minutes, not bad at all, got seated, waited another 15 minutes before a manager greeted us and got our drink order. He said our server would be with us soon but she never came. She had 3 tables in her section making us her 4th table. Had a manager not taken care of us, and I mean from start to finish, this rating would be a lot lower. P.s. We never saw our server at our table...

Today has to take the cake for the best service I've received here. I ordered the bacon pepper burger ($14.99) which isn't the typical choice for me but I thought hey that looks like a good burger versus my normal clucks and fries or chicken salad. Well we had to wait to order our food and the time to receive our food was ridiculous. When I got my burger it wasn't warm at all. I don't need it piping hot but at least some warmth come on. Let me feel like my burger was sitting there for a while. I never got the sauce that I asked for so I just got annoyed and went up and got it myself. The burger was suppose to come with pickles (the best part in my opinion) and didn't so I had to ask for that. And to top it off my sisters egg on her royal burger wasn't cooked all the way. The WHITE PART. I mean that's gross. Burgary looking stuff on a burger. Blehh annd they charged her for it so she wasn't having it. I told the waitress and she said that's something a manager has to approve. Needless to say the service here has never been spectacular to me so you won't see me run here anytime soon. I always go to bothell or woodinville (my favorite) because I know I'll get good service. Not treated like I'm the queen of England but your typical normal good service.

We went to Red Robin for a birthday and we were a very large group of 20+. Our server was Nate and he was AMAZING. He had all of our drinks out within 5 minutes, including alcohol, fries were at our table from the moment we got there and kept them full until we left, all of our orders were correct and he knew what every person had without looking at a list. Nate was amazing and the best waiter we have had when apart of a big group, and quite possibly the best waiter we have ever had. Thank you, Nate! :)

I used to love red robin. But now that they changed the way they do there burgers, it just went down hill very fast. They must have a new c.e.o. Or something. Because red robin sucks now....They don't wrap there burgers up anymore witch causes the burger to be a sloppy mess. I miss the basket the burger and fries used to come in. Now it comes on a plate. With a small little cup of fries. I never get napkins or silverware with my food whenever I go to this store...I have to get up and ask for them because nobody comes by to ask if you need anything else. Totally lame. This particular store in lynnwood was disgusting today. The table we were sat at was sticky and so were the seats. There was old what looked like milkshake  sprayed onto the framed decor picture next to our seat. It was all dryed up and and sticky.The restrooms are nasty. Very dirty. The manager of this store should be ashamed of himself. They need to stay closed for a day and do a deep cleaning of everything. Oh and those high chairs for the baby's to sit in are absolutely horrendous......disgustingly dirty. I had to use 10 baby wipes to clean it so my son could sit in it. I will never go there again . And the health department needs to pay them a visit. Because if the bathrooms are nasty, and the dining room is nasty, think of how the kitchen looks. I have had it with red robin. I'm not spending my money there ever again......

The food is always the same, so service matters and this place sucks. Took four different people and 15 minutes to get my to go order that was ready when I walked in. Management needs process training.

Had a great evening with my kids at Red Robin. The food is always consistently good and tonight was no exception. My daughter and I each tried the smoke and pepper Angus burger with smoked pepper bacon and extra sharp cheese. I had a regular bun instead of the ciabatta bread it comes with because I find ciabatta bread a bit too thick and chewy for my tastes. Great tasting burger. My son had the ghost burger with enough spice and jalapeños to blow my head off but even added Chipotle sauce to his burger. We tried sweet potato fries and they were great.

Ordered take out lunch from here for our office and everything looked horrible and was a mess. We complained and were given gift cards to try it again. We did and had the same result. Dine in might be great but take out quality leaves A LOT to be desired....

I wouldn't call it gourmet. I'd say a step up from Sherry's and Denny's. Black and Blue burger is good. Southern style burger was good. Men's bathroom is functional but has graffiti and you can tell they are not going to take care of it. Women's was clean and tidy. Overall ok experience.

Before Katsu Burger opened across the street, this was our go-to eatery when near the Alderwood Mall.  Now it's a tie.  This RR location has never steered me wrong.  I've been with family, and with friends, and on all those occasions nobodies orders were messed up, the food arrived swiftly and presentably and just as asked for.  When you ask for pink in your burger, you get pink, unlike the Everett one which often takes that as a cue to char the beef black.  If you want to get your Red Robin on, this is a great location to do so.  Staff is friendly and quick, and this location has far less screamy kids than the Everett one, if at all, when I've been there.

My family and I used to eat here quite a bit. But the last year or so has been hit or miss with food quality. Service was good, food was not. Frankly, it's boring and RR no longer has the market cornered on gourmet burgers.  There are MANY joints doing it way better. My burger was luke warm, no sauce, meat was tough and the fries were stale tasting. They were also not warm and they were hard.  Too much bun for the meat/fixings.  The tomato was mushy and flavorless. My daughter had the fish and chips, the fish was smoking hot but her fries were also cold and hard.   We asked for more fries, which came but were very, very overcooked. I won't be going back to this location or Everett RR.
Super friendly Team, very good managed and my best burger (Black & Bleu) ever!  Fresh, perfect taste and a good size. Perfect !

I normally think Red Robin is pretty ok with yummy fries . . .this visit however was beyond not good.  When I walked in the hostess was arguing with someone (boyfriend maybe?) which set the tone for awkwardness.  My food came out cold and some of it ice cold.  I was suppose to have bacon and gauc on a chicken lettuce wrap which they didn't put on.  So I asked nicely, 15 minutes later out comes some soggy bacon and literally ICE bloc guacamole.  I'm not even joking -- it was frozen and in a nice dish . . .so someone dished it out frozen and served it.  Um, wow.  The chicken was cool to the touch but fully cooked (so straight from the freezer with the fake grill marks).  I don't remember them being this way. My fries were luke warm, and my waiter had to take my coke away just as he was about to set in on the table because it "didn't look right" to him.  My waiter was really hustling bringing a couple orders back to the kitchen that I could tell and people were generally unhappy.  I felt really bad for him, so I couldn't bring myself to ask for a refund.  But I should have because I didn't eat the food, and I paid with my hard earned money.  Not only did I leave hungry, but grossed out by the food served.  I will NOT be going back here.  They need an overhaul desperately.
This location is always consistent with their food and service. And always accommodating to our requests!

We just returned from Red Robin's Lynnwood store (near Alderwood Mall) and it was one of the most unpleasant dining experience I've had in a long time. The restaurant is unkept with dirty floors, sticky tables and horrible bathroom conditions (including chewing tobacco on the urinals). I ordered a Royal Red Robin Burger and was served 9-10 small stubs of broccoli (with brown spots) and a half cooked egg white sliming down the sides of the meat. It was uneatable and I had to send it back. What was most alarming was the lack of cleanliness. A busier simply brushed food debris to floors leaving some of it on the table. On the floors were old napkins and random piece of paper towels near the bathroom entrance. Children were eating directly off of dirty, sticky tables. A baby was mouthing the side of a dirty table. Red Robin went from one of my favorite restaurants to one to avoid in the span of only an hour.

We waited over an hour for out table. Once we were sat the table it didn't fit our entire party of 10. Our table was also in he dark because the one light that shines on our table was burned out. When I asked if the other lights could be turned we were told no because they were for the other tables which each had their own overhead light and no one was sitting at. One hour wait, table that doesn't fit us, and darkness is the worst! We even talked to a manger and she could do was apologize and offer us the table behind once the patrons were gone and it was cleaned. Never again this was the last time. Second time in 6 months we came in and waited more then an hour to be seated. We figured it happens but fool me once shame on you fool me twice I'm done!
I am thoroughly impressed how well the costumer service was and how fast our food came on a busy night. Good job keep it up!

This is your average American burger joint. The onion rings are good and crunchy, there are free refills on the root beer floats, they have "bottomless fries." They have gluten free buns, but not a dedicated fryer/cook station, so if your celiacs is pretty bad, go for a salad.  If you do not like children, this is NOT the place for you. There is always some kind of party going on, or there's some baby screaming- but this is marketed as a "family restaurant," so it's to be expected.  If you're 21+, go to the bar. I've never ordered anything alcoholic but I still get prompt service, I don't feel rushed, and I'm somewhat distanced from the children. The con of the bar is it's right next to the arcade area, so if it's a really busy night you're still going to be listening to some child screaming about something.  My favorite thing to order is the Clucks and Fries- aka chicken tenders and fries. They're pretty big pieces of chicken and steak fries and are pretty filling. There's a lot of breading on the chicken, so if you don't like breaded chicken, take a pass.  My husband loves the A1 burger. It's just a good ole fashioned messy burger with steak sauce.  The root beer floats are pretty good, too. Like I said- free refills. Kinda sweet.

The burger was dry and expensive. This place is always crowded, over hyped... there are other better burger joints nearby.  Opt for the regular fries, the garlic fries are a dollar extra but aren't really garlic fries, they are just regular fries drizzled with the red-robin rub, which is kept on each table anyways.
bad service not value for tips！！！we are standing at the door for 10 mins without a guy serive eventhough just say hello，no！ no！no！

The only reason this Red Robin is getting two stars is because Nate,  our waiter was nice.  The service was slow,  the presentation was horrific,  and their fries are definitely not what they use to be.  Red Robin's fries used to be big, and crispy on the outside and soft on the inside and you'd get a lot of them.  Now you get a child's-size handful of small, broken, over-cooked crisps; ask for a refill and you get a tiny basket with less of the same thing.  The salad (Bonzai) looked like an 1/8th of a cup of mandarin oranges thrown onto a small bed of under-crisp iceberg and a small,  tender breast drizzled with teriyaki. The chill chili burger also drizzled with about an 1/8th of a cup (ok, maybe a 1/4 cup) of chili. ..more and more disappointed with a place that my kids grew up loving.

I don't know what it is about this location but the hostesses are always so rude! I don't need some high school girl rolling her eyes when I'm asking her a question she does not know. It's not our fault you're having a bad day, don't take it out on the customers. I have had the same hostess 3 times in the past and each time I'm getting a sassy vibe from her. I've told the manager but it doesn't do much. Other than that problem the waiters and waitresses are always very nice, but I'm giving it 2 stars because the hostesses always leave a bad taste in our mouths.

Over the years, the more I go to Red Robin, the more I realize how stagnant the restaurant is. It's really always the same old same old and it doesn't really even feel like a classic same old same old. Nothing special, just the average American burger joint. I keep coming back nonetheless though so I guess there's that. It was a Saturday night so the wait was unsurprisingly pretty long. The hostesses were not all too friendly though, yelling out names and getting frustrated when no one would reply but not even bothering to go outside to call the name there either even though there was clearly people waiting outside as well. One of the hostesses was also wearing a jacket over her uniform and I found that odd. All in all, I found them pretty unprofessional but it wasn't that big of a deal. Our server was very nice and helpful and our food came out in a good amount of time. I always order the same thing here, the Clucks & Fries and the Bottomless Freckled Lemonade and with a pretty basic order, it's pretty hard to be disappointed by food quality. Overall, I'll keep coming here because it's an easy location to go with all your friends but it's truly nothing overly special. The magic only comes in all the good times I've spent here with my friends.

The electronic ordering system needs a lot of work. I pressed the button to summon a waiter (I had questions about my order), and waited 15 minutes. That is unacceptable. A waiter never appeared, so I gave up and ordered food via the buttons. That was another 15 minute wait for a simple salad and iced tea. The food is at best average, the wait too long, and the service indifferent. There are many other restaurant choices in the immediate vicinity, so I will not be revisiting RR.

This location is great for groups, particularly during the construction. We had a large group gathering recently and we were seated with no problems. If you're looking for a decadent burger, fried food, and other fatty goodness, this is the right place for you. My kiddo loves their mac and cheese. If, like me,  you're on a diet or can't really partake in such foods, this place is a drag.  Yes, I am aware they can do lettuce wraps. On this particular trip, I asked to have my burger wrapped in romaine instead of iceberg - no can do. No worries, I had the grilled chicken instead, sans the bread. They have all you can eat fruit just like all you can eat fries. The pineapple was really good; the strawberries were frozen and reconstituted into a pulpy mess that was completely inedible. All you can eat of that? Nope.  The highlight of the last group lunch were the tablets on the table where you could play angry birds and pay from your seat. One member of my group wanted to pay with cash and pressed the button to flag the server that never came. Finally, she gave up and paid with a card, which was not what she planned. Technology was helpful to those of us that wanted to run out but doesn't work for everyone. There is still no substitute for good customer service.

Had a terrible meal at this location, we were sat in a section with no lighting, I had to use my flashlight app to read the menu.  The service was OK but they messed up our orders and the food was only barely warm

I'm a huge fan of Red Robin, locations in the Bay Area are really inconsistent and usually the workers are really rude. However, every time I visit Seattle this place always has the best service and food. Today I came with my dad and brother. Wait was 20 minutes and then we were seated, instantly ordered our drinks which came out quickly. Strawberry lemonade is pretty great here.  We ordered the Red Robin Gourmet Burger, Bleu Ribbon Burger and Clucks and Fries. I substituted for sweet potato fries (costs $1.49 extra) and my brother substituted for Garlic Fries ($0.99 extra). Our food came out within 10-15 minutes. Everything was great, the meat in the burgers were really juicy and tender.The chicken tenders were crispy, sweet potato fries were also a great choice. The only con was probably the garlic fries, they just spread the garlic parmesan over the fries which was eh. Our server was extremely nice and constantly checked up on us asked if we wanted a refill on drinks or our fries and those came out fairly quickly. Definitely will come back.

For most of the RR (Red Robin) places that I have been to, this one seems to be the best in terms of food quality and service. Came here with my family for a dinner and the wait wasn't too bad. If you come here at peak dinner time, expect at least a 20 min+ wait. RR doesn't take any reservations, so keep an ear out for when the hostess/host calls your name. When we finally got seated, we were greeted with a super cheerful waitress who throughout the evening, provided great service and attention to whatever we needed. For food, we ordered a variety of things: tower of onions, teriyaki flavored boneless chicken wings, mix of entrees, and drinks. Food quality in general here is great. Not only are the food hot and fresh (compared to other locations, the food is often lukewarm or sometimes cold), but we didn't wait very long for our meals.  The tower of onion rings were delicious. Crispy and hot, and paired with ranch and honey mustard sauce, it's one solid appetizer. As for the teriyaki wings, these were super crunchy and the sauce itself wasn't too overwhelming. For me, I decided to venture on the healthy side and tried a burger with a lettuce substitute instead of buns and that proved to be quite good and flavorful.  For sauces to eat with your fries/burger, I highly recommend trying out: Campfire, Buzzard, Honey Mustard, and the Bacon sauce. All of these were super yummy and added a nice flavor to the food. Do note that premium sauces like the bacon cost extra while other sauces are on the house.  Overall, had a really good experience here and my family and I would love to visit again.

The unlimited fries alone is enough for me to keep coming back here. The burgers are always fresh and cooked just the way I like it! The servers are polite and attentive. The remodel definitely changed the mood of the place, and it has worked in their favor. I'm a regular and that won't change anytime soon! Keep up the great work!
Updating to add that Red Robin has contacted me and apologized. I spoke with corporate and the GM; and received a gift card. I'm impressed and appreciative of how it was handled.

Best service on a to go order  Jeremiah was so incredibly helpful and knowledgeable as I was trying to order something 100% vegan. He truly cared and I was about to order sauce that I personally was unaware had animal products in it  and he educated and  taught me something I didn't know and I've been vegan for 2 years!   This person definitely needs a pay raise because you can tell he cares about his job and the customers.  I will go out of my way to come to this location and I live 45 minutes north.

Service in the bar when they are busy is not that great. We were here on a busy weeknight around dinner time and were scoping out the bar for a table to sit sooner than the regular space. Once seated, the table was cleared off quickly by a passing busser, which was a good sign. We met our server, he left menus and came back a few minutes later to ask for our drink order. We weren't really drinking anything, so we both asked for waters and said we were ready to order if that was okay. The server actually said no, he wouldn't take our order now as he wanted to take people's orders in the order they arrived. I was like: Okay, sure, thanks. Really though? This is the bar, it's first come, first served. We're ready to order. We didn't have drinks to order, so we were ready to order food. He could have said anything else to delay taking our order: I need to get my notepad, I will when I come back with your waters, anything else. Really? He came by with our waters and had his pen out to take our orders. We were both starving, so I asked that our fries come out early. He said: No. Again. I was like: Uh..... He said: Well, I doubt that'll happen. I was like: Okay. This restaurant is known for their bottomless fries, fries is most of the business. Come on, now.  Our early fries did come out, which was appreciated. Then another person brought out our burgers and I figured I'd ask HER for more fries in advance. She said she'd tell our server (inward groan). He came by to ask how everything was going a few minutes later and I asked for fries then, which we got. I was really hungry.  By now, the bar/restaurant was less crazy. So I think he felt less stressed and became a better server. On the surface, we got everything we asked for, in a reasonable amount of time, but his demeanor in the beginning was pretty bad. After this experience, I'm not interested in the bar at this location if I can help it.

I love Red Robin and eat at all the locations on a very frequent basis, but this one is the closest to my house, making it my primary location. Its one of the few chain restaurants where I can easily get a Boca burger and still make my other dining partners happy. The menu seems to always be adding new things and has a lot of options for people who don't like burgers, however convincing them of this can be hard. I also love that they ask you what sauce you want for your fries when you order as I am one of those people who do not like ketchup. Or if you are on a health kick you can get salad or broccoli instead. Everything here is very customizable and the nutrition calculator online is pretty great too.  I also find that the bar is a pretty nice place just to meet someone for drinks. Or to have a meal before heading off to the movie theater across the street. Service is usually fast and efficient. Its even nicer now that you can pay from the kiosk at your table, although it only allows you to order drinks and appetizers. Refills here come easily. It can be a bit loud and table wait times can be long. I almost always peek in the bar before getting on list if I don't have children with me since this is usually a faster way to get services. This location has just recently been remodeled and looks pretty snazzy.

(Kind of a late review but) I was here a few weeks ago. It was extremely busy and there was a big line. But we got seated at the bar very quickly. Despite the fact that they were very busy, the server did an excellent job with taking our order and being attentive whenever we pressed the Call Server button.

Once one of my favorites, Red Robin for me has steadily been sliding downhill. They still do an A-OK job (hence the 3 star rating). The staff is polite and clearly well trained. Two things stand out in my mind - the restaurants seem to be getting a little dated and worn looking; and - they had this electronic game/payment thing dominating our small table for two. It looked a little grubby so it was not something I really wanted interact with, let alone have taking up valuable table space.  My food, too, just did not have that same great taste to me. Not sure if they changed something or if places like Teddy's Burgers, Blazing Onion, and my all time favorite Rain City Burgers simply have raised the bar higher.

Oh. My. Gosh.  We came to Red Robin because tonight was kid's choice and, despite my protests, this is where they wanted to go. I have previously had some pretty bad experiences at RR, but tonight was VERY different. First off, we were greeted by a smiling and friendly hostess. Despite it being fairly busy, in less than 5 minutes after arriving we were seated. Within a minute or two, our server, Kelsea came to take our drink orders. These were delivered very promptly, and the refills happened quickly. (this is always important as my husband and son are thirsty caterpillars and drink like they've been stranded in the desert for days) Kelsea took our order, and our food came out so quickly. Everything was hot, fresh and tasted good. Our orders were all correct. Throughout the meal, Kelsea made it a point to check in on us and provide us with the refills that my guys so desperatley needed. Before tonight, I was pretty hesitant to return to RR, but after this experience, I'm looking forward to the next time our it's our kids' turn to choose.

Food was good, company was good. However, the server we had was very rude. We didn't get him name, but he had lots of attitude and whenever we talked to him he would glare at us. No good customer service means no tip. Oh well!

I love this places food & for the most part, I've always had good service. But the hosts are forever the rudest people. I'm sitting across the waiting area, watching her talk shit about every single person in this waiting room. Mocking people who are bothered by the long wait. You work at Red Robins honey! Put a smile on your face & take the sh#t talking out! It's almost ridiculous that she can't bother to be professional when she's the first face people see. This is when you know a company no longer focuses on customer service. Complete BS.

We had a nice day and wanted to celebrate family member so went to Red robin. and it was totally wrong choice. host served us ( again, we were family ) the worst seat where are too bright to open our eyes ( need sunglasess ) and eat food even though there are bunch of good place to sit. we could not understand that everyone else were sitting good place because of very very shiny day except us. this is obviously that we were discriminated by front desk hosts who showed us seat and kept giggling especially host two girls. what is funny? they seems no educated and never learn people manner and restaurant service at all. the worst experience and memory ever. I will never go RR with anybody. there are so many good people place.

My husband, daughter and I are vegans, and we love that Red Robin has Boca vegan burgers as an option.  We ordered the Keep It Simple with Bottomless Fries, and the Volcano Sauce (at the suggestion of the server).  The fries are wonderful, the burgers were done just right, and when we asked for extra pickles, we were accommodated without any problems.  I treated myself to the Speckled Lemonade (a portion of the price goes to help the non-profit Alex's Lemonade Stand).  The drink was just the right amount of sweet and tangy, with a touch of strawberry.  The lemonade is bottomless, too, which is nice, so you really feel you are getting your money's worth.   Our server was attentive and friendly.  We had a wonderful time and highly recommend it!
This restaurant had terrible service and a dirty atmosphere. It took forever for a waiter to even come and he frequently forgot our request for refills on fries and drinks.

We ordered burgers and fries with a couple of changes. When the kitchen missed them the manager gave us our dinner free! Our server Sydney was very nice and worked with the manager to make everything wonderful! Even when things don't go just right it is great when helpful staff keep you coming back!
